page.title: 14CRAWLEY DOWN YOUTH GROUPS
page.content: In Crawley Down, children are very lucky. There are a number of clubs, including two{Scout}troops, two{Cub packs and a{Beaver}lodge who meet in their own hut each week. The two{Guide companies and the two{Brownie}packs meet at the{Community Centre.}Most of them go to camp in the summer. Children keen on sports are catered for; the{Minors Football Club}runs five teams in local leagues and the {Stoolball Club}has a junior section. They both meet on the{Haven Sports {Field.}The{Tennis Club}coaches juniors in{King George's Field}and the{Cricket {Club}has a beginners' group who play on their own ground in{Sandy Lane. The{Senior and Junior Youth Clubs}meet in their own premises at the{Community {Centre.}The{parish church}has its own youth groups and children can join the {choir}when they are seven years old.
